formula: Let P_0(x) = Q_0(x) = 1. For n > 0, P_{n + 1}(x) = P_n(x) + x^(2^n)*Q_n(x) and Q_{n + 1}(x) = P_n(x) - x^(2^n)*Q_n(x). Then, a(n) = discrim(P_n(x)). Note also that discrim(P_n(x)) = discrim(Q_n(x)). - _Sean A. Irvine_, Nov 25 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
